revised_title: Chromatology of Actinia: Observations on Coloration and Pigment Extraction
tldr: The author examines the chromatology of Actinia, investigating the pigments and coloration in various species. They discover that the coloration in Actinia mesembryanthemum closely resembles that of reduced haemoglobin, and they successfully extract pigments using glycerin. The author also explores the decomposition products of these pigments, finding similarities to those obtainable from haemoglobin.
